description: From Middle English sacren, sakeren, from Old French sacrer (“to hallow”), from Latin sacrō (“to make sacred, consecrate”), from sacer (“sacred, holy”).

verbs.description: sacre (third-person singular simple present sacres, present participle sacring, simple past and past participle sacred)

examples: And thou schalt clothe Aaron, thi brother, with alle these, and hise sones with hym. And thou schalt sacre the hondis of alle; and thou schalt halewe hem, that thei be set in preesthood to me.

entries.meaning: Alternative form of saker (“type of cannon”)
